p: Our afforestation estimates may be too conservative by limiting them to nonforest areas within current forest boundaries and 127,000 ha of irrigated grass cropland. There was a net loss of 367,000 ha of forest area in Oregon and Washington combined from 2001 to 2006 ( 23), and less than 1% of native habitat remains in the Willamette Valley due to urbanization and agriculture ( 24). Perhaps more of this area could be afforested.
